articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Verbal Personal Message in Memory of Jong Ju Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Verbal Personal Message in Memory of Jong Ju Yong 
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a verbal personal message in memory of Jong Ju Yong, former honorary chairman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his death.
					 Kim Jong Il said in the message that Jong Ju Yong paved the way for national reconciliation and cooperation and did really a great job for the development of the inter-Korean relations and the sacred cause of national reunification.
					
					 He prayed for the happiness of Jong Ju Yong and hoped that everything would go well in the family of Hyundai.

articles.title: Measures Taken to Prevent Earthquake Damage
articles.content:
Measures Taken to Prevent Earthquake Damage
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Bureau of Earthquake has taken measures to cope with possible earthquakes.
					 The bureau has strengthened seismological observation and renewed the nationwide observation system.
					
					 Major seismological observatories have been reinforced with up-to-date equipment. 
					
					 Surveys of ground water level, terrestrial magnetism and geological structure have been made to observe a slight seismic sign in a scientific way.
					
					 Media of the DPRK provide information about earthquake and volcano to the local people, calling on them to pay attention to abnormal doings of animals and phenomena.

articles.title: Masses Praying for National Reunification Held
articles.content:
Masses Praying for National Reunification Held
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- "Masses praying for national reunification commemorating the Nirvana Day" were simultaneously held at temples across the DPRK at 10:00 on Saturday. 
					 Present there were office-bearers of the Central Committee of the Buddhist Federation of Korea and its provincial, city and county committees, priests and monks of temples and Buddhists. 
					
					 Rituals for commemorating the Nirvana Day were made to be followed by speeches and prayers for national reunification at the masses. 
					
					 Speakers said that the Nirvana Day is being commemorated at a time when all the people of the country are waging a dynamic general offensive to bring about a decisive turn in building a thriving nation by intensifying the drive for a radical improvement in the standard of people's living in hearty response to the joint New Year editorial. 
					
					 They called on all the Buddhists at home and abroad to unite in Dharma-mind under the uplifted slogan "Let all Koreans in the north, south and abroad join efforts to open a new phase of independent reunification!" and thus defuse the confrontation between the north and the south and the danger of war as early as possible and actively promote dialogue and cooperation. 
					
					 The prayers said that the reckless moves of the south Korean authorities to provoke a war against the DPRK are getting evermore undisguised despite its efforts for dialogue and peace. 
					
					 Underscoring the need for all the Buddhists at home and abroad to devote themselves to the practical actions for national development and prosperity on the basis of reconciliation, harmony, peace and equality, the prayers expressed the hope that an earthly paradise where the idea of getting rid of pain and achieving happiness will come true in the land of 3000-ri will be built in the present century as early as possible.

articles.title: Thaethan Razor Shell Registered as National Heritage
articles.content:
Thaethan Razor Shell Registered as National Heritage
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Cultural Relics Conservation Guidance Bureau of the DPRK has registered things of historical and academic significance as national heritages.
					 One of them is razor shell living off Thaethan, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 It, known to be tastier and cleaner than razor shells living off Ongjin and Ryongyon, is very popular in local and foreign markets.
					
					 It is taken in the way of sliced raw, pickled, fermented, steamed and fried dishes. It is very efficacious for stomach trouble, bronchial asthma and other diseases.

articles.title: Large-scale Magic Show under Preparation
articles.content:
Large-scale Magic Show under Preparation
Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Preparations for a large-scale magic show are being made at the final stage.
					The stage for the show has already been prepared at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang.
					
					The stage, covering some 1,900 square meters, is flanked with electronic displays and other devices.
					
					Laser illuminators, projectors and other equipment have been installed at the stadium to provide three-dimensional decorations to the stage.
					
					The performance will also be bedecked with fireworks and light music. 
					
					Its premiere will be given on April 18.

articles.title: Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
articles.content:
Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Indoor Stadium is one of the popular sports centers in the DPRK.
					 It is usually crowded to capacity on Sundays and holidays.
					
					 Table tennis, volleyball, basketball, tennis and other sports events are available inside and outside the stadium. 
					
					The stadium also has amusement and public service facilities.
					
					 Ri Kum Il, a 47-year-old worker of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, told KCNA that he comes to the stadium in red-letter days together with his family members to play table tennis.
					
					 Kim Hak Ryong, a 71-year-old man living in Pothonggang District, said he likes to see his grandsons enjoying amusements in the stadium.

articles.title: Bamboo Streets in Haeju City
articles.content:
Bamboo Streets in Haeju City
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Bamboo streets have appeared in Haeju City of South Hwanghae Province, the DPRK.
					 More than 300,000 bamboo trees, over 2.5 meters high, have been planted along streets extending 12 kilometers in eastern and western parts of the city.
					
					 The bamboo trees, along with maple, ginkgo and other roadside trees, add beauty to the streets.
					
					 Bamboo trees have also been planted in an open space in front of the Undok Health Complex.

articles.title: Sharp Contrast between Two Social Systems
articles.content:
Sharp Contrast between Two Social Systems
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Korean youth, out of their sound view of life, are devoting their energy and wisdom to the worthwhile effort for the prosperity for the country.
					 They are active in the army, industrial establishments, farms, construction sites, universities and scientific research centers.
					
					 Many of them enjoy public favor for what they did for the country and the people. Many monuments were named after Chongnyon (youth).
					
					 But in the capitalist society, young people have become the cause of social trouble.
					
					 A 22-year-old man shot and killed six people and wounded thirteen in Arizona State, the United States, in early January.
					
					 Many young people in capitalist countries are addicted to alcohol and drug, with no ideal and ambition, and commit suicide.
					
					 The facts offer a striking illustration of the fundamental contrast between the two social systems.

articles.title: US Position as World's "Only Superpower" Is Sinking: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US Position as World's "Only Superpower" Is Sinking: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Criticism of the U.S. position as the "only superpower" in the world is often heard from the international community. This fully reflects the reality today when the U.S. position as the "only superpower" in the world is sinking.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has behaved as the "only superpower" in the world since December 1989 when it declared the demise of the Cold War but its era as the world's "sole superpower" is drawing to a close.
					
					 A proof of this is the fact that the U.S. is losing its privileged position in many aspects in the world political arena.
					
					 The U.S. finds itself in a tighter corner in the UN arena. It was often driven into such position that it stood trial for its human rights abuses.
					
					 The U.S. sphere of economic domination in the world is also sinking. 
					
					 The U.S. proportion in the world gross output value continues going down.
					
					 It has a serious budget deficit and huge foreign debts due to its economic structural contradictions and imbalance and the steadily increasing military spending, etc.
					
					 The U.S. can no longer pressurize others by dint of its dollars.
					
					  Asia, Africa, Latin America, Europe and other regions countries are taking joint actions to introduce unitary currency on a regional scale to replace dollar. The U.S. military edge in the international arena is also getting weak. 
					
					 It finds a vivid expression in the U.S. "war against terrorism." 
					
					 U.S. troops are suffering political and moral setbacks in Iraq and Afghanistan.
					
					 The U.S. is no longer world "leader", "only superpower" and "an international judge." The U.S. will find itself further isolated and repudiated worldwide unless it is awoken from its old dream of being the world's "only superpower".

articles.title: Independent and Peaceful Reunification Is DPRK's Consistent Stand
articles.content:
Independent and Peaceful Reunification Is DPRK's Consistent Stand
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is consistent in its stand on the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a by-lined article.
					 Since the very day of the division of Korea, the DPRK has made consistent efforts to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Koreans by driving foreign forces out of south Korea, the article notes, adding:
					
					 The Korean nation has lived as a homogenous one generation after generation. If the Koreans unite close in actions, rejecting the alien aggressor forces under the uplifted banner of independence, they can certainly accomplish the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Conniving at the foreign forces' interference without independence will lead not only to infringing upon the interests of the nation but to bringing its destiny to ruin in the end.
					
					  A north-south military clash would bring nothing but disasters to the Korean nation and its territory. It is foreign forces who will benefit from this fight. 
					
					 The peaceful reunification of Korea is not only the wish of all the Koreans but the desire of the world peace-loving people.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities' moves to start a new war should not be overlooked in the least. They should be held in check under any circumstances as they are a blatant challenge to the Korean nation desirous of the peaceful reunification of the country and criminal acts of threatening its destiny.

articles.title: Anniversary of Arson Attack on Pusan "American Cultural-Service" Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Arson Attack on Pusan "American Cultural-Service" Observed 
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- It is 29 years since the arson attack was mounted on the Pusan "American Cultural-Service" in south Korea in protest against the United States' military occupation and colonial rule over it.
					 Entering the 1980s the U.S. imperialists instigated the south Korean military fascist group to turn Kwangju where the struggle for democracy against fascism raged into a sea of blood, dampening the desire of the south Koreans from all walks of life for independence, democracy and reunification. This laid bare their true colors as man-killers and aggressors.
					
					 Mun Pu Sik and Kim Un Suk of Pusan Koryo Theological College, Ryu Sung Ryol and Choe In Sun of Pusan National University and other patriotic youth and students set fire to the Pusan "American Cultural-Service," an annex to the Pusan office of the U.S. embassy in south Korea on March 18, 1982. They, at the same time, distributed hundreds of leaflets around a theatre, department store and two other places in the city.
					
					 The leaflets contained such slogans as "Yankee go home", "No U.S. neo-colonialism", "The attack on the American Cultural-Service is just a beginning of the anti-U.S. campaign" and "Let citizens in Pusan  turn out in a nation-wide sacred struggle, holding a torch of anti-U.S. struggle." They greatly encouraged the citizens. 
					
					 The arson attack was an eruption of the south Koreans' pent-up anti-U.S. sentiment and their grudge against it. It was a courageous action as it gave a fresh momentum to the anti-U.S. struggle for independence. 
					
					 This attack triggered off actions to set fire to the "American Cultural-Service", the U.S. embassy and other colonial ruling institutions in various parts of south Korea and occupy them and sit-in strikes. This was also followed by dynamic actions against the U.S. imperialists' war exercises against the DPRK and their moves to interfere in the internal affairs of south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean people are now turning out in a nation-wide anti-U.S. struggle, chanting the same slogans as shouted by the participants in the Pusan "American Cultural-Service" arson attack.

articles.title: Actions against Building of Naval Base on Jeju Island Launched
articles.content:
Actions against Building of Naval Base on Jeju Island Launched
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- An all-islanders measure committee for checking the building of a military base on Jeju of south Korea held a rally on Jeju Island on March 14 denouncing the authorities for their moves to build the naval base on the island.
					 At the rally speakers accused the Jeju Island Assembly of supporting the authorities in their move to build the naval base on the island.
					
					 They stressed that all the people on the island would stage actions against the building of the naval base by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Scandals Rife in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scandals Rife in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Scandals of south Korean diplomats have been recently disclosed one after another, sparking public furor.
					 They reportedly led a corrupt life, having unsound sexual relations with local women. They pocketed public funds by falsifying the period of official visits, increasing the number of participants in dinners and faking up papers for the purchase of houses, cars, etc. Not content with this, they sold off even important secrets.
					
					 After seizing power with all sorts of lies and gimmicks the present chief executive of south Korea worked hard with blood-shot eyes to lay his foundation throughout the society and establish a dictatorial system.
					
					 As this adversely affected even the personnel affairs, many persons were able to hold important posts of power according to cronyism with the chief executive, irrespective of public opinion at home and abroad and professional qualifications.
					
					 Choe Si Jung, who once contributed to the chief executive's win in the "presidential elections", took the post of the chairman of the Broadcasting and News Service Committee and Hyon Pyong Chol held the post of the chairman of the Human Right Committee, beating all other rivals.
					
					 Hyon In Thaek, Won Se Hun, Kim Kwan Jin and other anti-DPRK confrontation maniacs forsaken by the people took important posts including the Ministry of Unification, the Intelligence Service and the Ministry of Defense. Kim Jong Gi was also appointed as consul general at a time when chiefs of the diplomatic and consular missions abroad were appointed for the first time after the formation of the "government".
					
					 Those having the ties of fellow provincials with the chief executive organized a private organization called the Yongpho Society, backed by power. They distributed power among themselves, riding roughshod over personnel affairs. The public is stunned by this practice.

articles.title: Korean People's Building of Thriving Nation Praised
articles.content:
Korean People's Building of Thriving Nation Praised 
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- World public is expressing admiration at the Korean people making a dynamic advance towards a thriving socialist nation full of conviction of sure victory and optimism. 
					 The Nepali paper Arpan noted that the army and the people of the DPRK are performing feats every day with patriotic devotion to the country, firmly convinced that the day is sure to come when they will enjoy great happiness as long as they are led by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association noted that the Korean people successfully launched two satellites by their own efforts and with indigenous technology, built the UHP electric arc furnaces, perfected a Juche-based steel-making system and broke through the ultra-modern level of CNC technology, he added.
					
					 The Finnish paper Tyokansan Sanomat said that late in the last century the imperialist allied forces claimed it was a matter of time for the DPRK to collapse but it embarked upon the road of building a socialist thriving nation to win the admiration of the world. 
					
					 The Thai paper Xing San Daily said that the DPRK, now a political, ideological and military power, will be called a thriving nation both in name and reality if it attains the goal of an economic power.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Joint Military Exercises Flayed in Portugal
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Joint Military Exercises Flayed in Portugal
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Portugal-Korea Friendship Association issued a statement on March 14 in protest against the U.S. and south Korean joint military exercises.
					 The statement said that the joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. and south Korea are a blatant challenge to the aspiration and wishes of the Korean people for the independent reunification and peace of the country and the moves against DPRK to ignite a new war on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The DPRK has demonstrated its might as a political, ideological and military power and Korean-style socialism been reliably defended thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, it noted.
					
					 The organization urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to stop at once the joint military exercises and opt for detente on the peninsula.

articles.title: Quake Death Toll on Steady Rise in Japan
articles.content:
Quake Death Toll on Steady Rise in Japan
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The explosion of reactors at the Fukushima nuclear power plant is further deepening the crisis.
					 The white smoke seen as steam was confirmed to have been emitted from Reactors Nos. 2, 3 and 4. on Friday. It was reported that a large amount of it was emitted from Reactor No. 3. 
					
					 It was confirmed that the temperature of spent fuel rods in the storage pool of Reactor No. 4 was 10 times higher than that of Reactor No. 3. 
					
					 The Japanese government noted the accident at the nuclear plant is the worst in the history of the country. 
					
					 At a time when Americans are seized with uneasiness as even the U.S. is fraught with the danger of radioactive substance leakage, AP released a report that an observation station in California detected radioactive substance believed to have leaked out of the above-said power plant.
					
					Meanwhile, the death toll caused by the killer quake and the ensuing tsunami reached about 7,200 as of 09:00 on Saturday.
					
					 It was reported that the quake and the ensuing tsunami left 11,991 houses completely destroyed and more than 452,000 people homeless and 1 232 sections of roads damaged. 
					
					 About 1 million people are now suffering due to an acute shortage of water and about 343,000 families left without the supply of electricity. 
					
					 The National Land and Geography Agency of Japan quoting a survey said that more than 400 square km were submerged by tsunami.
					
					 Aftershocks are going on. There were 262 aftershocks of magnitude 5.0 and above as of noon Friday after the occurrence of the quake.   NHK reported that there were 37 aftershocks of magnitude 1.2~5.9 from 17:01 on Friday to 16:24 on Saturday.

articles.title: Review of Japan's Nuclear Power Generation Policy Called for
articles.content:
Review of Japan's Nuclear Power Generation Policy Called for
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Japan Times on Tuesday carried an article titled "Nuclear Power in Disarray".
					 It said;
					
					 Once the reactors automatically shut down following the quake and if normal electrical power supplies are cut off, diesel generators are supposed to kick in to power an emergency core cooling system to prevent meltdown of the nuclear reactor. Unfortunately, the diesel generators were swamped by the tsunami and failed. This opened the door to meltdown, which creates the potential for radioactive materials to be released into the environment.  
					
					 These events have led the government to declare a "nuclear emergency situations" for the first time ever, destroying the credibility of the claim by the government and electric power industry that nuclear power generation is safe. Japan's nuclear power generation policy must be strictly reviewed.

articles.title: Chinese Premier on Safety of Nuclear Facilities
articles.content:
Chinese Premier on Safety of Nuclear Facilities
 Beijing, March 17 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao, in an executive meeting of the State Council Wednesday, called for safety check and enhanced management over nuclear facilities. 
					 "Safety is our top priority in developing nuclear power plants," the State Council said in a statement released after the meeting.
					
					 It called for a comprehensive safety check and enhanced management over existing plants. It also stressed the need to step up monitoring of radioactive substances and issue alerts timely.

articles.title: China to Step up Construction of Basic Procuratorate Facilities
articles.content:
China to Step up Construction of Basic Procuratorate Facilities
 Beijing, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Supreme People's Procuratorate of China, at a recent meeting, called on the procuratorate organs across the country to further strengthen the construction of their fundamental facilities. 
					 Hu Zejun, executive deputy chief procurator of the Supreme People's Procuratorate, said that this work is related to the all-round prosecution affairs and its prospective development.

articles.title: China Promulgates Amended Rules on Hazardous Chemical Products
articles.content:
China Promulgates Amended Rules on Hazardous Chemical Products 
 Beijing, March 17 (KCNA) -- China recently promulgated amended rules on safe handling of hazardous chemical products.
					 The rules have the aims of strengthening the safe handling of the hazardous chemical products, preventing and reducing the accidents caused by them, ensuring the safety of the life and property of the masses and protecting the environment.
					
					 The rules call for maintaining the policy of comprehensive handling of the hazardous chemical products with main emphasis on the prevention of accidents while giving top priority to the safety of the products. They also stipulate that the responsibility of the enterprises should be made clear.

articles.title: Indian Government Orders Food from Japan to Be Tested for Radiation
articles.content:
Indian Government Orders Food from Japan to Be Tested for Radiation
 New Delhi, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Indian government has recently ordered food originating from Japan to be tested for radiation.
					 The measure has been taken in the wake of explosions at a Japanese nuclear plant following a devastating earthquake-tsunami last Friday.
					
					 Authorized officers of Food Safety and Standards Authority of India at Indian ports and  airports have been asked by the government to get food originating from Japan after March 11, 2011 to be tested for radiation, according to Press Trust of India on Wednesday.

articles.title: Germany to Shut down Seven Nuclear Plants
articles.content:
Germany to Shut down Seven Nuclear Plants
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The German government on Tuesday said it is temporarily shutting down seven of its 17 nuclear power plants while it launches a three-month review of its energy policies. 
					 This measure was reportedly taken following the explosions of nuclear reactors in Japan.

articles.title: Russian Army Continues to Stay in Southern Kurils
articles.content:
Russian Army Continues to Stay in Southern Kurils
 Moscow, March 17 (KCNA) -- Minister of Defence of Russia Anatoly Serzhukov on Wednesday said that the Russian army would continue to stay in southern Kurils. 
					 Russia will modernize armed equipment of the units deployed on the islands, he said.

articles.title: South Africa Rejects US Request
articles.content:
South Africa Rejects US Request
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The South African government said on Tuesday it had rejected a U.S. request to block former Haitian President Jean Bertrand Aristide's return to Haiti.
					 The deputy Foreign Minister of South Africa said that the country does not have the legal facilities to stop the return to Haiti of Aristide. 
					
					 "It is not for us to say if Aristide should or should not leave South Africa before elections in Haiti," he said.

articles.title: Kyrgyz Court Sentences US Businessman to 15 Years
articles.content:
Kyrgyz Court Sentences US Businessman to 15 Years
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A Kyrgyz court has recently sentenced American businessman Eugene Gourevich to 15 years in jail in absentia. 
					 A sentencing statement said a District Court in Bishkek convicted him of selling a fuel depot in Kyrgyzstan to a U.S. company at a price below the market rate. 
					
					 The depot is at an airport used as a U.S. air base.

articles.title: Nigerian Parliament Passes Bill on Office of Anti-terrorism Coordinator
articles.content:
Nigerian Parliament Passes Bill on Office of Anti-terrorism Coordinator
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian House of Representatives on Tuesday passed the bill for an act to establish the office of the coordinator on anti-terrorism. 
					 The office shall coordinate the collection of intelligence on the activities of terrorists. It will also coordinate all response to act of terrorism when it happens.

articles.title: Palestinian National Authority Rejects False Report of Israel's Newspaper
articles.content:
Palestinian National Authority Rejects False Report of Israel's Newspaper
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the chief of the Palestinian National Authority vehemently refuted the false report by an Israeli newspaper on March 15. 
					 Israel's Haaretz newspaper reported recently that the Israeli government approved the construction of new houses in the West Bank after coordinating with the Palestinian National Authority. But the spokesman dismissed this as a fabrication. 
					
					 "The Palestinian position in public and in secret is firm; settlement construction is unacceptable," he declared.

articles.title: US Accused of Allowing Smuggling of Weapons into Mexico
articles.content:
US Accused of Allowing Smuggling of Weapons into Mexico 
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Mexican Senator Yeikol Polenski in her recent statement to Prensa Latina said that it is unacceptable for the U.S. authorities to allow smuggling of weapons into Mexico.
					Such practice of the U.S. is intolerable as it is interference in her country, she noted, adding that the U.S. organized coups by selling weapons to organized crime groups and drug traffickers, and as a result, at least 36,000 Mexicans have died.

articles.title: Positive Development for Stability of Philippines
articles.content:
Positive Development for Stability of Philippines 
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Philippines has made much effort to achieve the country's stability and progress.
					 The Philippine government and the opposition National Democratic Front (NDF) held talks, the first of its kind after six years, in Oslo, Norway on Feb. 22, and reached an agreement on some issues.
					
					 In a joint statement published after the talks, they agreed to complete the peace talks within 18 months.
					
					 After taking office as president last year, Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino set it as a major policy of the government to create a peaceful atmosphere of the country and took some constructive measures to this end.
					
					 The opening of the peace talks is a result of the present government's positive measures.
					
					 Most of the Philippine people expect that the long-standing dispute, which successive presidents failed to solve, will be settled during Aquino's term of office.

articles.title: LPRP Congress Opens
articles.content:
LPRP Congress Opens
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The 9th National Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party opened on Thursday in the capital city of Vientiane. 
					 Present there were 576 delegates. 
					
					 General Secretary of the Central Committee of LPRP Choummaly Saynasone gave a political report. 
					
					 In the report he detailed achievements and challenges over the past five years after the 8th National Congress of the party. 
					
					 The congress will continue until March 21.

articles.title: Safe Landing of Space Capsule
articles.content:
Safe Landing of Space Capsule 
 Moscow, March 17 (KCNA) -- A capsule of spaceship Soyuz with crewmen of international space station aboard safely landed on the steppe of Kazakhstan on Mar. 16, according to a center for flight operation on the outskirts of Moscow.

articles.title: Water Level of Seas Rises Due to Global Warming
articles.content:
Water Level of Seas Rises Due to Global Warming
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The water level of global seas is steadily rising due to global warming, sparking off deep concern.
					 According to a recent international survey, ice is rapidly melting in Greenland and the Antarctic Continent. If ice melts at this speed, the water level of seas will be 15 centimeters higher in 2050 than the present level.
					
					 Sea water at present rises about 3 mm every year.

articles.title: Water Crisis Poses Threat to World
articles.content:
Water Crisis Poses Threat to World
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The water problem is presenting itself as a serious one due to the rapid increase of population, climate change by global warming, excessive consumption of industrial and agricultural water, water pollution, etc. worldwide.
					 For the past several decades the amount of water used increased 4-8 percent every year. Water will be reportedly more precious than oil worldwide in the future as agricultural water accounts for 70 percent and industrial water 20 percent in the amount of fresh water used.
					
					 According to a survey published by the UN, 884 million people do not use clean water at present worldwide and 5-6 million people die every year of diseases caused by foul water.
					
					 That is why many countries are paying great attention to the work to protect water resources and settle the water problem.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje oral en memoria de Jong Ju Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje oral en memoria de Jong Ju Yong
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio un mensaje oral en memoria del ex presidente honorario del Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea, Jong Ju Yong, con motivo del 10o aniversario de su fallecimiento. 
					La misiva recuerda que Jong hizo gran aporte para explorar el camino de reconciliacion y cooperacion nacionales, lograr el desarrollo de relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y cumplir la sagrada causa de reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					El remitente oro por el difunto y deseo que todo vaya bien en la familia de Hyundai.

articles.title: RPDC refuerza medidas preventivas frente al terremoto
articles.content:
RPDC refuerza medidas preventivas frente al terremoto
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ATCC) -- Causan grandes calamidades a la humanidad los terremotos que atacan ultimamente a varios paises.
					  El Buro de Sismologia de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea toma medidas efectivas para prevenir los posibles danos de temblor.
					
					  En escala nacional se intensifica la observacion del fenomeno no solo de los especialistas sino con la participacion de todo el pueblo.
					
					  En los principales observatorios estan llegando los equipos modernos.
					
					  A traves de la investigacion de los niveles de aguas subterraneas, magnetismo terrestre y estructura geologica, se realiza cientificamente la deteccion de las senales del terremoto.
					
					  Se profundiza tambien el estudio sismologico sobre el Oceano Pacifico y Eurasia.
					
					  Por otra parte, los medios de comunicacion masiva como periodicos, TV y radios, dan a conocer a los habitantes los datos de referencia sobre terremoto y volcan.
					
					  Se impulsa ampliamente la propaganda exigiendo a los habitantes prestar atencion a los movimientos anormales de animales y a los cambios de fenomenos naturales.

articles.title: Actos budistas en los templos de la RPDC
articles.content:
Actos budistas en los templos de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar a las 10 de este sabado en los templos de distintas localidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los actos budistas para la reunificacion de la patria en ocasion del Dia de Nirvana de Buda.
					Participaron alli los clerigos del Comite Central de la Federacion de Budistas de Corea y de los comites provinciales, urbanos y distritales de esta entidad, los monjes y los creyentes de los respectivos templos.
					
					En las ocasiones se efectuaron las ceremonias y hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que conmemoran el Dia de Nirvana de Buda en estos momentos en que todo el pueblo del pais, en pleno acato al editorial conjunto publicado con motivo del ano nuevo, se levanta energicamente en la ofensiva general para registrar un cambio decisivo en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera avivando las llamas de gran auge para la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo. 
					
					Todos los budistas en el Norte, el Sur y en ultramar deben unirse con la devocion budista bajo la consigna de "!Con la fuerza unida de todos los compatriotas del Norte, el Sur y el extranjero, abramos una nueva coyuntura para la reunificacion independiente!" para eliminar cuanto antes el peligro de guerra y la confrontacion entre ambas partes coreanas y promover activamente el dialogo y la cooperacion. 
					
					Luego, se dio lectura a la oracion desiderativa de reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					El documento se refiere a que ahora se tornan mas siniestras las imprudentes maniobras belicas de las autoridades surcoreanas contra la RPDC, pese a los esfuerzos de esta por la paz y el dialogo. 
					
					Todos los budistas dentro y fuera del pais deben incorporarse a la marcha por la prosperidad de la nacion mediante la reconciliacion, la unidad, la paz y la igualdad, destaco y deseo que se levante el paraiso sobre este territorio patrio de tres mil ri (10 ri equivalen a 4 kilometros).

articles.title: RPDC decidida a reunificar el pais por via pacifica-Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
RPDC decidida a reunificar el pais por via pacifica-Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ATCC) -- Sigue invariable la posicion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de reunificar la patria de manera independiente y por via pacifica.
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					  Desde el principio de la division del pais, la RPDC viene luchando invariablemente por lograr la reunificacion de manera independiente y por via pacifica y con fuerzas nacionales expulsando a las fuerzas foraneas del suelo surcoreano.
					
					  Si la nacion coreana, que siempre ha sido homogenea y consanguinea, lucha firmemente unida contra las fuerzas extranjeras agresoras bajo la bandera de independencia en alto, podra cumplir sin falta esa causa nacional.
					
					  Pero, si se tolera la intervencion de las fuerzas foraneas agresivas sin mantenerse en la postura independiente, seran perjudicados los intereses nacionales y se echara a perder el destino nacional.
					
					  Cuando el Norte y el Sur de Corea se pelean apuntando a la contraparte con fusiles, la unica victima de ello sera la misma nacion coreana y su territorio se reducira a cenizas y escombros. Por el contrario, las fuerzas extranjeras se beneficiaran de esa pelea fratricida.
					
					  La reunificacion pacifica de Corea la desean tambien los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz.
					
					  No se puede permitir nunca las maniobras de Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas encaminadas a desatar la nueva guerra.
					
					  Esos actos criminales deben ser frenados a toda costa porque desafian frontalmente a la aspiracion nacional a la reunificacion pacifica y amenazan el destino de todos los coreanos.

articles.title: EE.UU. no es ya unica superpotencia, afirma Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
EE.UU. no es ya unica superpotencia, afirma Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ATCC) -- En la sociedad internacional circulan los comentarios que cuestionan la posicion de Estados Unidos de "unica superpotencia" del mundo.
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un articulo individual de este sabado, califica ese hecho de reflejo de la realidad de hoy y prosigue:
					
					Desde diciembre de 1989 cuando proclamo el fin de la guerra fria, EE.UU. actuo como "unica superpotencia" del mundo, pero, se esta acabando su tiempo. 
					
					  Lo comprueba que en la escena politica mundial, se debilita considerablemente la posicion privilegiada de EE.UU.
					
					  Su situacion en la ONU se hizo cada vez mas incomoda hasta que se vio obligado a sentarse en el banquillo de acusado por sus crimenes de violacion de DDHH. 
					
					  En el plano economico, se desciende cada vez mas el porcentaje de EE.UU. en el producto bruto mundial. 
					
					  Esta agobiado por enorme deficit presupuestario y deudas externas, generados por la estructura economica contradictoria y desequilibrada y los gastos militares en constante aumento. 
					
					  Mientras tanto, el dolar norteamericano enfrenta serios desafios como las acciones conjuntas de varias regiones y paises de Asia, Africa, America Latina, Europa, etc. dirigidas a introducir la moneda regional unificada. 
					
					Por otra parte, se va abriendo hueco tambien en la superioridad militar de EE.UU. en el mundo. 
					
					Las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes de Irak y Afganistan sufren la derrota politica y moral. 
					
					  EE.UU. no es ya el "lider" ni "superpotencia" del mundo ni "juez internacional". 
					
					  Si el imperio sigue embriagado de su viejo status de "unica superpotencia", sera asilado y rechazado mas en la arena internacional.
